definition: Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols and tools for building software applications
Representational State Transfer - an architectural style for designing networked applications
JavaScript Object Notation - a lightweight data interchange format
YAML Ain't Markup Language - a human-readable data serialization standard
Hypertext Transfer Protocol - the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web
Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure - HTTP with encryption using SSL/TLS
Open Authorization - an open standard for access delegation
JSON Web Token - a compact way to securely transmit information between parties
A small, independent service that performs a specific business function
A lightweight, standalone package that includes everything needed to run an application
A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications using containerization
An open-source container orchestration platform for automating deployment and management
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment - practices for automating software delivery
A query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries
A communication protocol providing full-duplex communication over a single TCP connection
Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security - cryptographic protocols for secure communication
An organized collection of structured information stored electronically
Not Only SQL - databases that provide flexible schemas for storing unstructured data
Structured Query Language - a programming language for managing relational databases
Content Delivery Network - a distributed network of servers for delivering web content
A device that distributes network or application traffic across multiple servers
A hardware or software component that stores data for faster future access
An in-memory data structure store used as a database, cache, and message broker
A document-oriented NoSQL database program using JSON-like documents
An open-source relational database management system with advanced features
A distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code
A web-based platform for version control and collaboration using Git
A DevOps platform that provides Git repository management and CI/CD pipelines
An open-source automation server for building, testing, and deploying software
An infrastructure as code tool for building and managing infrastructure
Amazon Web Services - a comprehensive cloud computing platform
Microsoft Azure - a cloud computing service for building and managing applications
Google Cloud Platform - a suite of cloud computing services
Software as a Service - software delivered over the internet on a subscription basis
Platform as a Service - a cloud computing model providing a platform for development
Infrastructure as a Service - cloud computing offering fundamental computing resources
